# NSView.Invalidations.Display

**Structure**

A change that requires the system to redraw a view’s content.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Display
```

## Overview

Use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewInvalidating/display] to create an instance of this type.

## Creating the invalidation type

- **display()**: Displays the view and all its subviews if possible, invoking each of the `NSView` methods [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/lockFocus()], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/draw(_:)], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/unlockFocus()] as necessary.
- **init()**: Creates the invalidation type.

## Invalidating the display

- **invalidate(view:)**: Indicates to the system that an aspect of a view is invalid and triggers the necessary update.

## Types of Invalidations

- **NSView.Invalidations.Constraints**: A change that invalidates a view’s constraints.
- **NSView.Invalidations.IntrinsicContentSize**: A change that invalidates a view’s intrinsic size.
- **NSView.Invalidations.Layout**: A change that invalidates the layout of the containing view’s subviews.
- **NSView.Invalidations.RestorableState**: A change that invalidates the restorable state of the view.
- **NSView.Invalidations.Tuple**: A change that invalidates a combination of factors covered by the other invalidation types.

## Conforms To

- NSViewInvalidating
